SEARCH
Package gw.datatype

Interface IPersistentDataType

public interface IPersistentDataType
Represents the persistence aspects of this datatype.
Author:
pdalbora

      Formats an application value as a SQL literal.

    • isCharacterBased

      boolean isCharacterBased()
      Indicates whether this datatype is associated with a length.

    • getLength

      int getLength()
      Gets the maximum length of values for this datatype. Throws an exception if this datatype is not string based.
      See Also:
      • isCharacterBased()

    • isDecimalBased

      boolean isDecimalBased()
      Indicates whether this datatype is associated with a precision and scale.

    • getPrecision

      int getPrecision()
      Gets the precision for this datatype. The precision is the maximum number of decimal digits that can be used to represent values for this datatype. Throws an exception if this datatype is not decimal based.
      See Also:
      • isDecimalBased()

    • getScale

      int getScale()
      Gets the scale for this datatype. The scale is the number of decimal digits to the right of the decimal point on values for this datatype. Throws an exception if this datatype is not decimal based.
      See Also:
      • isDecimalBased()

    • isPrimaryKey

      boolean isPrimaryKey()
      Indicates whether this datatype represents a primary key.

    • isEncrypted

      boolean isEncrypted()
      Indicates whether this datatype represents an encrypted value.

    • isSpatial

      boolean isSpatial()
      Indicates whether this datatype is a spatial one.

    • createSpatialIndex

      boolean createSpatialIndex()
      If this datatype is a spatial one, then returns whether it should have a spatial index. Else returns false;

    • getJdbcType

      GWJdbcType getJdbcType()
      Gets the JDBC type associated with this datatype.

    • getSize

      int getSize(Object beanValue)
      Parameters:
      beanValue -
      Returns:
      the size of the given object of this data type
